com.datamelt.util

Class Splitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datamelt.util.Splitter

  • public class Splitter
extends java.lang.Object
    splitter class which does the splitting of ASCII format based rows into separate fields using either a separator or an xml file, which defines the field positions in a fixed length ASCII file. the default is to use the semicolon (;) as a separator. a given row will be split into its fields using this separator or another given separator. it uses the java split method of the String class. the other possibility is to split a given row into its fields by providing an xml file, which defines the layout of the row. this way fixed length ASCII files can used, where the row has a fixed layout rather than a separator as the divider. in case a xml file is used, you have to pass its name to the setRowDefinitionFile() method. The file will be parsed and the input data (line) will be split into its fields accordingly. the getRow() method returns a Row object containing an array of fields representing a given row of data (passed as argument) after it has been split.
    Author:
    uwe geercken

        fieldSeperator - the separator that distinguishes the fields

    • Method Detail

      • setRowDefinitionFile

        public void setRowDefinitionFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        the layout of a fixed length ASCII row, can be defined in an external XML file. pass the name of the file to this method. the XML file will be parsed, so that the layout can be used.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the row definition file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception when the file was not found or can not be read

      • getFields

        public java.lang.Object[] getFields(java.lang.String line)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        returns an array of objects, containing the fields that the row consists of. the line argument is a line (or row) from an ASCII file.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an array of objects

      • getFields

        public java.lang.Object[] getFields(java.lang.String line,
                                    java.lang.String[] types)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        returns an array of strings, containing the fields that the row consists of. the line argument is a line (or row) from an ASCII file. The types argument is an array of field types corresponding to the individual fields. Field types (string, integer, date, etc) are defined as constants in this class
        Parameters:
        line - a line of data
        types - an array of types corresponding to the individual fields
        Returns:
        an array of objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if no row definition file is defined

        Parameters:
        fieldSeperator - the field seperator to be used to distinguish individual fields

      • getType

        public int getType()
        the type can be either a CSV file, which uses a seperator to devide one field from the other. or it can be a fixed length layout, where fields have an exact predefined length. in this case an xml file with the layout of the fields needs to be defined.
        Returns:
        the type of ASCII file

      • getTrimFields

        public boolean getTrimFields()
        indicates if all input data (fields) from the ascii file should be trimmed (both sides). only used for fix-length ascii files
        Returns:
        an indicator if all field values should be trimmed

      • setTrimFields

        public void setTrimFields(boolean trimFields)
        sets if the input data (fields) shall be trimmed (both sides). the value will only be used for fixed length ascii fiels.
        Parameters:
        trimFields - indicator if all field values should be trimmed

      • getRemoveQuotes

        public boolean getRemoveQuotes()
        indicates if a leading and trailing quote character (") should be removed. only used for csv files.
        Returns:
        indicator if all quote characters should be removed
